data.title: Children of the 80s, this Hunter Valley concert is for you
data.meta_description: Paul Young, Go West, The Cutting Crew, Wang Chung and Taylor Dayne lead an all-star '80s line-up at...
data.text:
Children of the ’80s, this one’s for you. Hope Estate is hosting a concert in November that might just inspire you to smear on the blue eyeshadow, crimp your hair and slip into those high-waisted chinos.

Subscribe now for unlimited access .

or signup to continue reading

All articles from the other in your area

Paul Young, Go West, The Cutting Crew, Wang Chung and Taylor Dayne will be joined by Aussie acts John Paul Young and The Allstars, Pseudo Echo and The Chantoozies for 80s FEST on November 4.

Paul Young is best remembered for hit singles included Love of the Common People, Wherever I Lay My Hat, Come Back and Stay, Everytime You Go Away and Everything Must Change, which all reached the top 10 of the UK singles chart. He won a Brit Award in 1985 for best male artist.

Paul Young

Go West – Peter Cox and Richard Drummie – enjoyed massive international success with hits such as We Close Our Eyes, Call Me and Don’t Look Down. Their biggest hit was The King Of Wishful Thinking which featured on the soundtrack to Pretty Woman and was a US top 10 hit.

Go West

Taylor Dayne’s hits included Tell It To My Heart, Prove Your Love, I’ll Be Your Shelter and Love Will Lead You Back, which all topped the Billboard charts. Taylor Dayne is also an actress, having appeared on the TV show Nightman and on Broadway in 2001 Elton John production Aida.

Taylor Dayne

English new wave band Wang Chung enjoyed their biggest success in the mid-1980s with songs like Let’s Go!, Everybody Have Fun Tonight and Hypnotize Me.

Cutting Crew are best remembered for songs (I Just) Died in Your Arms, I’ve Been in Love Before, One for the Mockingbird and Everything But My Pride.

Wang Chung. Picture: Simone De Peak

John Paul Young enjoyed worldwide chart success in the 1970s with Love Is In The Air. His long association with Vanda and Young has produced some of Australia’s most recognised songs including Yesterday’s Hero, I Hate the Music and Standing in the Rain. He was inducted into the ARIA Hall of Fame in 2009 and calls Lake Macquarie home.

Cutting Crew

Pseudo Echo had Australian top 20 hits with Listening, A Beat for You, Don’t Go, Love an Adventure, Living in a Dream and their cover of Funky Town (from Lipps Inc.).

The Chantoozies were one of Australia’s favourite female pop bands of the ’80s with songs such as Wanna Be Up, Witch Queen, He’s Gonna Step On You Again and Baby It’s You. The current line-up features three of the original band members: Totti Goldsmith, Ally Fowler and Eve Von Bibra.

Pseudo Echo

80s FEST tickets are available for pre-sale on Thursday, March 9, and for general sale on Friday, March 10, though Ticketmaster.

The Chantoozies
